oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Real Photo postcard of William Thomas McClain
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: William Thomas McClain was from the area along the Maury/Lewis County line and was born in Mt. Pleasant. He is shown wearing his uniform and holding an American flag. The postcard indicates it was from Jefferson Barracks, Missouri. McClain entered military service on June 28, 1918 and was assigned to the 157th Depot Brig. at Camp Gordon, Georgia. He was discharged December 28, 1918 having never left the United States.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McClain, William Thomas
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
